intro: Trachydium spatuliferum, commonly known as the spoon-leafed liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a mat-forming liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant features small, closely packed leaves that are often spoon-shaped, giving it its common name. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophores, are specialized for sexual reproduction and are often found on the upper surface of the leaves. Trachydium spatuliferum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
